trustfund:
TF056748-JSDF PAKISTAN: BUILDING

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Earthquake
            Emergency Recovery Credit Project for Pakistan are: (i) to
            reduce the immediate suffering resulting from the effects of
            the earthquake and restore livelihoods destroyed by the
            earthquake; (ii) to restore basic services to the affected
            population and rebuild public infrastructure; and (iii) to
            start the recovery and reconstruction process. The
            additional financing and restructuring will support the
            Government of Pakistan (GoP) efforts to respond to the loss
            of life and destruction wrought by the recent floods,
            helping to finance some of the critical imports necessitated
            by the disaster. The credit is part of the first phase of
            the World Bank's strategy to assist in the floods
            recovery in Pakistan, helping to ensure the availability of
            adequate fuel supplies essential for relieving suffering and
            beginning the restoration of the productive capacity of the
            economy. The financing will cover expenditures incurred by
            the GoP on motor gasoline, jet fuel, and diesel imports
            needed for recovery efforts, which will be determined on the
            basis of import Bills of Lading.
